channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [WFLY-4280] Component upgrade of Hibernate Validator to version 5.1.next.Final when HV-861 is fixed
item.description:
The version of Hibernate Validator included in WildFly 8.1 and 8.2 throws an ArrayIndexOutOfBounds exception when deploying some applications. This is already reported in the Hibernate Validator JIRA:

https://hibernate.atlassian.net/browse/HV-861
item.summary: Component upgrade of Hibernate Validator to version 5.1.next.Final when HV-861 is fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Simple application reproducing the issue. Build with "mvn package" and try to deploy.

Thanks for letting us know about the https://hibernate.atlassian.net/browse/HV-861 issue but there is no changes needed in WildFly, until HV-861 is available in a HV release. At that time, please create a WildFly WFLY-NNN jira requesting a component upgrade of HV to the new version.

The HV fix will not be back ported to WildFly 8.1 or 8.2 (as they are already released and do not change after being released).

Juan Hernández, what exactly do you want me to do to reproduce the problem. Your setup contains a bunch of domain classes and create a jar file with an empty beans.xml. I deploy this jar via the jboss command line client and get:

21:27:15,018 INFO  [org.jboss.as.server.deployment] (MSC service thread 1-7) JBAS015876: Starting deployment of "hv-861-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar" (runtime-name: "hv-861-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar")
 
21:27:15,859 INFO  [org.jboss.weld.deployer] (MSC service thread 1-7) JBAS016002: Processing weld deployment hv-861-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
 
21:27:16,355 INFO  [org.hibernate.validator.internal.util.Version] (MSC service thread 1-7) HV000001: Hibernate Validator 5.1.3.Final
 
21:27:16,859 INFO  [org.jboss.weld.deployer] (MSC service thread 1-5) JBAS016005: Starting Services for CDI deployment: hv-861-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
 
21:27:17,148 INFO  [org.jboss.weld.Version] (MSC service thread 1-5) WELD-000900: 2.2.6 (Final)
 
21:27:17,321 INFO  [org.jboss.weld.deployer] (MSC service thread 1-5) JBAS016008: Starting weld service for deployment hv-861-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
 
21:27:20,193 INFO  [org.jboss.as.server] (management-handler-thread - 2) JBAS018559: Deployed "hv-861-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar" (runtime-name : "hv-861-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar")

According to your description I would have expected this to throw an exception. I am also a bit surprised that your code does not contain any actual Bean Validation constraints. There is a @Valid on a string property, but that is not a constraint and in the context of Bean Validation does not even make sense, since @Valid is used to trigger cascaded validation for object graphs which does not really apply to a "simple" string.

Are you sure this is what I need to reproduce the problem? It would be great if you could double check your attached tarball and provide some detailed instructions on how to reproduce the error. Last but not least, I am using Wildfly 8.2.0.Final "Tweek"

What I did to reproduce this is building the example application and trying to manually deploy it, something like this:

cd hv-861
 
mvn clean package
 
cp target/hv-861-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar /whatever/wildfly-8.2.0.Final/standalone/deployments/.
 
cd /whatever/wildfly-8.2.0.Final/bin
 
./standalone.sh

The result is this error message in the standard output:

  10:16:32,198 ERROR [org.jboss.msc.service.fail] (MSC service thread 1-7) MSC000001: Failed to start service jboss.deployment.unit."hv-861-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar".WeldStartService: org.jboss.msc.service.StartException in service jboss.deployment.unit."hv-861-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar".WeldStartService: Failed to start service

The annotation isn't relevant, as long as it triggers the call to org.hibernate.validator.internal.cdi.ValidationExtension.processAnnotatedType. If you prefer you can replace @Valid with @NotNull, or any constraint, the result is the same.

I tested this with OpenJDK 7 and OpenJDK 8.

I tested it with WildFly 8.2.0.Final "Tweek":

10:26:36,546 INFO  [org.jboss.as] (MSC service thread 1-6) JBAS015899: WildFly 8.2.0.Final "Tweek" starting

Previously I tested it with 8.1.0 as well, and the result is the same.

And you have no other modifications to the Wildfly container? I am still not able to re-produce this. I get:

/opt/java/wildfly/bin]$ ./standalone.sh 
=========================================================================

=========================================================================

The same for the HotSpot 1.8 JVM. The only difference I can see now is that you are using the OpenJDK. If it is a VM based problem, it would also explain, why we have not been able to re-produce it. I will try with OpenJDK. Any chance you could try a different JVM as well?

I tested this in Fedora 21, where only OpenJDK 8 is available. But I just downloaded and tested with the latest JDK 7 from Oracle (for Linux):

# java -version
 
java version "1.7.0_71"
 
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.7.0_71-b14)
 
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 24.71-b01, mixed mode)

The result is the same.

As the problem seems to be related to the presence of synthentic bridge methods it may be relevant the compiler that you are using. May it help if I send you the built binaries that I'm using?
Forgot to say that I'm not using a modified WildFly, just what is available in the web site. I downloaded it some time ago, will download it again now, just in case.

This is what I'm using:

# wget http://download.jboss.org/wildfly/8.2.0.Final/wildfly-8.2.0.Final.zi
 
# md5sum wildfly-8.2.0.Final.zip 
86a51782581b90db44958a0ee7002c14  wildfly-8.2.0.Final.zip

The result is the same.
The binary .jar file, generated with the compiler from the Oracle JDK 7.
Note that in the attached binary .jar file I replaced @Valid with @NotNull, the result is the same.

thanks Juan Hernández. I have not tried your binary yet, but I was able to re-produce the exception by using your original test setup running Wildfly with an OpenJDK version:

openjdk version "1.7.0-b147"
 
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.7.0-b147-20111031)
 
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 21.0-b17, mixed mode)

Somehow a very elusive bug. Now that I am able to re-produce it, I am hoping to be able to track it down.

Juan Hernández, any chance you could try with the attached Validator snapshot? Just replace the existing jar in modules/system/layers/base/org/hibernate/validator/main with this one. I hope this should fix the problem.
The attached snapshot solves the problem with the example application. I still have to try the real application, but that will take longer.

The attached snapshot solves the problem with the example application

great

I still have to try the real application, but that will take longer.

Ok. It would be great, if you could verify it. We are planning a release for Friday (5.2.0.Beta1). I think even without your additional feedback we will integrate the fix. In the worst case there is yet another case we need to address, but we can do that with a new ticket (in HV).
I repeated the test with the real application (using source from here, WildFly 8.2.0 and the attached snapshot) and I can confirm that the deployment error doesn't happen now.
HV-861 is marked fixed in 5.2.0.Beta1, should we upgrade WildFly 10 (master) to use HV 5.2.0.Beta1?

Hi Scott Marlow, actually there is not a Hibernate Validator 5.2.0.Final. This version should go into WildfFly 10. Could you take care of this or shall I create a pull request. Not sure whether another issue is necessary or this one is good enough!?
Scott Marlow, actually I created the pull request - https://github.com/wildfly/wildfly/pull/7815

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
